description:
Ahura Mazda stands as one of the most righteous and powerful figures in Persian mythology. Known as "The Wise Lord, Supreme Creator", this epithet captures the essence of their divine nature. 

According to Persian sacred texts, Ahura Mazda's origins reflect the eternal struggle between truth (Asha) and falsehood (Druj) The worship of Ahura Mazda became central to Persian religious practice, with devotees seeking their favor through fire temple ceremonies, ethical conduct, and ritual purity. 

The mythology surrounding Ahura Mazda reveals deep insights into Persian worldview, particularly concerning unknown and humanity's relationship with the divine. 

The legacy of Ahura Mazda extends far beyond ancient Persian civilization. Ahura Mazda's dualistic theology influenced later monotheistic religions. The ancient wisdom traditions continue to inspire modern Zoroastrian communities Scholars continue to study Ahura Mazda's mythology for its profound insights into Persian culture, religion, and philosophy.
